courses.label: MSN6414
courses.title: Data Management and Health Care Technology
courses.description: Learners in this course analyze the use of data and databases as key drivers in nursing informatics. Throughout the course, learners demonstrate competence in managing and interpreting data in such a way that enhances their roles and decision-making capabilities in todayâ€™s health care technology environments.

competencies.label: MSN6414_1
competencies.statement: Differentiate database standard terminologies used by different health information systems.

outcome.title: Integrate information technology to align with nursing practice.

competencies.label: MSN6414_2
competencies.statement: Apply data management techniques to decision making in nursing practice.

outcome.title: Integrate information technology to align with nursing practice.

competencies.label: MSN6414_3
competencies.statement: Create various data representation methods for reporting and professional communications.

outcome.title: Integrate information technology to align with nursing practice.

competencies.label: MSN6414_4
competencies.statement: Articulate strategies for querying and generating reports from health information system databases.

outcome.title: Integrate information technology to align with nursing practice.

competencies.label: MSN6414_5
competencies.statement: Communicate technical standards as they relate to various informatics technologies.

outcome.title: Integrate information technology to align with nursing practice.

competencies.label: MSN6414_6
competencies.statement: Communicate as a practitioner-scholar, consistent with the expectations of a nursing professional.

outcome.title: Interpret clinical nursing practice through the lens of nursing informatics.

courses.label: MSN6416
courses.title: Managing the Nursing Informatics Life Cycle.

competencies.label: MSN6416_1
competencies.statement: Explain the life cycle of a health information system, including implementation, testing, and support.

outcome.title: Lead the nursing informatics lifecycle.

competencies.label: MSN6416_2
competencies.statement: Incorporate project management principles into nursing informatics.

outcome.title: Lead the nursing informatics lifecycle.

competencies.label: MSN6416_3
competencies.statement: Evaluate hardware and software used in health information systems.

outcome.title: Lead the nursing informatics lifecycle.

competencies.label: MSN6416_4
competencies.statement: Apply change management strategies to nursing scenarios impacted by the daily use of health information systems.

outcome.title: Optimize workflow to maximize the impact of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6416_5
competencies.statement: Articulate what optimization means as part of the life cycle and how it supports the nursing process.

outcome.title: Lead the nursing informatics lifecycle.

competencies.label: MSN6416_6
competencies.statement: Communicate as a practitioner-scholar, consistent with the expectations of a nursing professional.

outcome.title: Interpret clinical nursing practice through the lens of nursing informatics.

courses.label: MSN6412
courses.title: Health Informatics Systems Planning, Analysis, Design, and Build for Nursing.

competencies.label: MSN6412_1
competencies.statement: Evaluate various electronic medical record systems used by nurses across different health care settings.

outcome.title: Optimize workflow to maximize the impact of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6412_2
competencies.statement: Propose health information designs appropriate to health care settings.

outcome.title: Integrate concepts of meaningful use into nursing informatics practice.

competencies.label: MSN6412_3
competencies.statement: Integrate health information system components into strategic planning for health informatics nurses.

outcome.title: Optimize workflow to maximize the impact of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6412_4
competencies.statement: Recommend appropriate workflows needed to meet meaningful use.

outcome.title: Optimize workflow to maximize the impact of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6412_5
competencies.statement: Recommend strategies to maximize efficiency, safety, and patient satisfaction using electronic medical records while providing nursing care to patients.

outcome.title: Optimize workflow to maximize the impact of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6412_6
competencies.statement: Communicate as a practitioner-scholar, consistent with the expectations of a nursing professional.

outcome.title: Interpret clinical nursing practice through the lens of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6410_1
competencies.statement: Integrate theories and models of nursing informatics into clinical nursing practice.

outcome.title: Interpret clinical nursing practice through the lens of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6410_2
competencies.statement: Analyze your workplace in terms of the standards of practice in nursing informatics.

outcome.title: Interpret clinical nursing practice through the lens of nursing informatics.

competencies.label: MSN6410_3
competencies.statement: Identify the regulatory bodies, rules, regulations, and requirements that pertain to your workplace.

outcome.title: Integrate concepts of meaningful use into nursing informatics practice.

competencies.label: MSN6410_4
competencies.statement: Integrate ethical and legal practices into delivering quality health care using technology in various environments.

outcome.title: Integrate concepts of meaningful use into nursing informatics practice.

competencies.label: MSN6410_5
competencies.statement: Articulate the concept and framework of meaningful use and its impact on nurses as end users of health information technology.

outcome.title: Integrate concepts of meaningful use into nursing informatics practice.

competencies.label: MSN6410_6
competencies.statement: Communicate as a practitioner-scholar, consistent with the expectations for a nursing professional.

outcome.title: Lead the nursing informatics lifecycle.
